title: Long Division
text: Put the answer, $$x$$, in the quotient over the $$x$$ term.\nMultiply $$x$$ times $$x+5$$. Line up the like terms under the dividend.\n##figure3.gif##
speech: Put the answer,  x , in the quotient over the  x  term.\nMultiply  x  times  x plus 5 . Line up the like terms under the dividend.\n##figure3.gif##

title: Long Division
text:
Subtract $$x^2+5x$$ from $$x^2+9x$$.
You may find it easier to change the signs and then add.
Then bring down the last term, $$20$$.
##figure4.gif##
speech:
Subtract  x squared plus, 5 x  from  x squared plus 9 x .
You may find it easier to change the signs and then add.
Then bring down the last term,  20 .
##figure4.gif##
pacedSpeech: .You may find it easier to change the signs and then add.Then bring down the last term,   20

title: Long Division
text:
Divide $$4x$$ by $$x$$. It may help to ask yourself, “What do I
need to multiply $$x$$ by to get $$4x$$ ?”
Put the answer, $$4$$ , in the quotient over the constant term.
##figure5.gif##
speech:
Divide  4 x  by  x . It may help to ask yourself, “What do I
need to multiply  x  by to get  4 x  ?”
Put the answer,  4  , in the quotient over the constant term.

title: Long Division
text: Subtract $$4x+20$$ from $$4x+20$$. We get $$0$$ so there is no remainder.\n##figure7.gif##
speech: Subtract  4 x plus 20  from  4 x, plus 20 . We get  0  so there is no remainder.\n##figure7.gif##
